mr-1-en.text: Pure adrenaline from start to finish!

mr-2-en.text: The scene with two actual twin actors is the only decent part of the movie.

mr-3-en.text: I may be a hardcore biker but I have to say: I cried like a baby!

mr-4-en.text: The romantic subplot is sooooo boring!

mr-5-en.text: Best sci-fi movie EVER, even if it's quite old!

mr-6-en.text: A short movie made on a low budget and it shows!

mr-7-en.text: Finally, a whole cast of non-traditional families #top #films

mr-8-en.text: Come on, a cook that becomes a top chef in a few months? Not really believable.

mr-9-en.text: Silly comedies like this are just what it takes to get me in the festive spirit.

mr-10-en.text: Now that's a bad prequel to a classic film! Shame on them!

mr-11-en.text: The film is based on a children's story but is made of adults. Amazing!

mr-12-en.text: First it was a book. Then a game. Then a TV series. Now we have the movie. When will it end?

mr-13-en.text: I love spaghetti westerns and this is no exception. Great cinematography.

mr-14-en.text: The end with a cliffhanger but there will be no sequel to this story. What a waste of time.

mr-15-en.text: The ultra violent scenes are a feast for the eyes for fans of the genre.

mr-16-en.text: The film exists just to sell gadgets and merchandise. But I'm buying none of it.

mr-17-en.text: This goes straight to the podium with the best sports movies.

mr-18-en.text: The actor playing the pirate is as expressive as a wooden plank.

mr-19-en.text: I had no idea Japanese horror movies were so scary.

mr-20-en.text: A three-hour movie all shot in the same room? No, thank you.

mr-21-en.text: A great film about a journalistic investigation that happened 50 years ago.

mr-24-en.text: Of all the films to have zombies in, why THIS ONE?

mr-25-en.text: A bittersweet comedy you have to see, highly recommended.

mr-26-en.text: I missed the first ten minutes and so I got lost in the overcomplicated plot.

mr-28-en.text: I have never heard of the comic book that inspired this story. I hope it's better than the movie!

mr-29-en.text: Handsome archaeologist: CHECK! Thrilling adventures: CHECK! What else could you ask for?

mr-30-en.text: The underlying political message seems a bit controversial to me, what was the point in making this movie?

mr-31-en.text: The classic "they hate each other but they need to work together" plot still works!

mr-32-en.text: The film is ok but who translated the original title so badly?

mr-33-en.text: Talking animals on the big screen: always a blast!

mr-34-en.text: The celebrated "twist ending" was obvious after about 20 minutes...

mr-35-en.text: I doubted this could work as a silent movie. I was so wrong.

mr-36-en.text: European critics call it a "masterpiece". I call it a "sleeping pill".

mr-37-en.text: You will find yourself whistling the title track from this cheerful musical for days.

mr-38-en.text: Are you telling me this mess took TEN years to make?

mr-39-en.text: Best animated movie I've seen recently. Excellent use of 3D!

mr-40-en.text: I only liked the final act with the giant robots.

mr-41-en.text: That's a fun parody of the classic movie, right from the title.

mr-42-en.text: THREE... TWO... ONE... aaaand the bomb is disarmed at the very last second. So original.

mr-43-en.text: They made the story of a criminal trial compelling to watch... Kudos!

mr-44-en.text: I did not expect this to be during World War II. That's so confusing.

mr-46-en.text: All the characters are subtitled... in different languages. Who thought of that?

mr-47-en.text: A very delicate, introspective film. So lovely!

mr-49-en.text: Fighting scenes in this movie are perfectly choreographed!

mr-50-en.text: A truly terrible movie. Nice costumes, though.

mr-51-en.text: I love the movie. As a plus, now I know how to plan a prison break.

mr-52-en.text: I was loving it... until it completely switched genre in the final act.

mr-53-en.text: I was amazed to find a pacifist point of view in a war movie. Very moving.

mr-54-en.text: So... it was all a dream in the end? I want two hours of my life back.

mr-55-en.text: As soon as they start talking with their Victorian British accent I am in love.

mr-56-en.text: The dream sequence at the end is too long and confusing.

mr-57-en.text: They weren't my favorite rock band, but after watching their biopic I bought all of their albums!

mr-58-en.text: Parents beware! Not a film for kids!

mr-59-en.text: Another superhero movie... and this is super-cool! Wow!

mr-60-en.text: It was a bad idea to cast a comedian for a dramatic role.

mr-61-en.text: This heist movie is going to steal a lot of awards. Do you see what I did there? LOL.

mr-62-en.text: The only good thing about this movie is the location, I will book a holiday there.

mr-63-en.text: Powerful wizards, majestic dragons, magic swords... an amazing fantasy movie

mr-64-en.text: All the characters are too stupid to be believable.

mr-65-en.text: If you don't appreciate this classic gangster movie you will be sleeping with the fishes.

mr-66-en.text: They say this is an "experimental filme". I say the experiment has failed.

mr-67-en.text: There are many movies about dance companies, but this is the best.

mr-68-en.text: Spoiler: The "hero" is a vampire. That's probably why this movie sucks.

mr-69-en.text: The main character is the anti-hero we need right now.

mr-70-en.text: The title alone screams "boring movie". Why didn't I listen to it?

mr-71-en.text: Prepare the handkerchiefs, you will cry a lot at this true story!

mr-72-en.text: So many plot holes. Did anyone check the final script?

mr-73-en.text: Shooting this in black and white was a great idea for such a poetic movie.

mr-74-en.text: I'm not convinced about the idea of using puppets instead of actors to tell this story.

mr-75-en.text: I have seem this new movie about time travel next Monday and I loved it.

mr-76-en.text: A cast of adults playing the parts of kids. Cringe!
highlights: adults playing the parts of kids

mr-77-en.text: An original modern adaptation of a classic fairy tale. Five stars!

mr-78-en.text: This is the last movie of the trilogy and is definitely the worst...

mr-79-en.text: The movie has let me know about this woman, a real hero of our time!

mr-80-en.text: I prefer the theater play, way more deep.

mr-81-en.text: A mythological movie that is really... mythical!

mr-82-en.text: Too short and messy. It would have worked better as a miniseries of six episodes.

mr-83-en.text: There's a lot of debate, but for me, this is the best chapter of this spy story saga.

mr-84-en.text: Maybe they should have spent a little more to fix the bad special effects. They look so cheesy.
